website_summaries.verdict: Showcasing a number of useful accessories, this reliable filter is a great fit for those seeking a multi-function straw.
pros: Can screw directly onto plastic water bottles
Filters out almost all bacteria and parasites
Includes a carabiner, bear whistle, compass, and signaling mirror
cons: The included whistle did not work

customer_reviews.title: Better than lifestraw
customer_reviews.text: I have both....this water filter is the same size as lifestraw....but filters 130 gallons more and at .1 micros which is better than .2 microns from lifestraw and at $3 cheaper per filter. U should be able to read the info for yourself on my pic. I will buy this instead of lifestraw from now on. It's a no brained. And NO, I did not receive this discounted or free for this review. Just thought it would be smart helpful info to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: CrystalTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design even though it feels cheap. Lose the silly toy compass and whistle to make it even better. Being able to screw it onto water bottles makes it invaluable.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 8

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, having a clean water back up is always a must. Affordable and arrived on time. Would do business with again.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Chinese Christmas game. It was the most popular thing there. Makes a great gift and is practical because if the apocalypse comes or you need access to clean water for any reason, this is something that is always good to have on hand. This could save your life, and it produces enough clean water to save the lives of many people if it had to for quite a while. I also heard that .1 μm is a good filter size because it not only filters bacteria and amoeba from water but also very small viruses.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Pope

customer_reviews.title: Great filter wish I could have gotten another
customer_reviews.text: Went to Kyrgyzstan last year and this straw filter purifies water very well. I was up in the mountains for 7 days and it filtered anything from a stream passing through a horde of cow droppings to river/lake water without any flavor of anything mixed with the water. I even have a picture of the tap water that the people of the town drink and how this straw filters out the rock, cloudiness, and smell from the water. I am happy that I purchased this or I would have been having the toughest time dealing with a upset stomach and diarrhea like my friend had lol.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, just what I was hoping it would be. A few ways it can be used yet takes up less space than most basic filter straws. The compass, whistle and signal mirror is a nice added touch. One of my member groups are selling this with a video for $69. The only difference is that it has a different name printed on it and the rubber tubing is a tad bit longer. I'd jump all over this deal if I were you,
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product. I love all of the little survival ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I love all of the little survival extras that come with it. It is not only a water filter but also has a whistle, compass & mirror that could be used for many things. Love that it comes with a carabiner to attach to anything & it is very lightweight. Directions are great
customer_reviews.author: DragonMaddie08

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find a Straw Filter down to .1 microns. Usually the best I've seen is .2 microns unless you go for a larger pump or gravity unit. Twice the filtration at the same price sounds good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Burroughs

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I could not wait when this arrived. I drink from the dirty dish water that has been sitting for a week. This gadget made it taste like bottle water. I would have attached a picture but it was hard to do a selfi.
customer_reviews.author: WesWes

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: The filter straw came in packaged well. Sealed inside of 2 separate bags. Works well with a water bottle and tap water. Haven’t used it in any sort of survival situation just yet. Does take a little effort to fit on some water bottles
customer_reviews.author: taylor

customer_reviews.title: We hope never to need them
customer_reviews.text: Bought some to put in the autos with the emergency kits.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Sewage never tasted so good
customer_reviews.text: Even water straight from the commode tastes great. I was drinking from mud puddles and anything I could find holding water. I'm still alive so it gets 5 stars but if I happen to die I will come back and change it to one Star.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoadley

customer_reviews.title: Sweet filter, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Tested this out with a few Survivor water bags and it works perfectly. 1 liter to 1 liter takes a few minutes, but SO worth it for clean water. I carry 2 1 liter Survivor bags and a canteen in my EDC bag along with the filter.
customer_reviews.author: LeppardQueenTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I had to try it before I needed to and it works great. Going to buy more just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Compass and whistle don't work.
customer_reviews.text: Compass and whistle don't work. While not the primary function of this item, these features were the reason for selecting it over other cheaper water filters of the same quality and function. Figure I can put a working compass in place of the nonfunctional one, but the whistle is useless except maybe to store some fire starting materials.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Small and light
customer_reviews.text: Tested with known drinkable stream to have extra protection, not sure about other types of water source. Good multi-function filter. The only downside is water still stay inside the tube after several weeks of use, if I try to shake the water out it's charcoal colored. Good at $14.99
customer_reviews.author: Lim, TY

customer_reviews.title: About what was expected
customer_reviews.text: I introduced my boyfriend to camping and he was dying to try the fresh spring water. I purchased this as a surprise and he was bouncing off the walls. He tried the straw and was happy with it. I wouldn’t recommend relying on the compass or whistle in an emergency but the straw worked as expected. As for the compass and whistle, they don’t really work. The compass isn’t accurate and the whistle doesn’t make noise.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ziller

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Bug out bag, emergency supply item. Drinkable water is second only to shelter in an emergency, survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: eric sautter

customer_reviews.title: waiting for an emergency
customer_reviews.text: Don't take the middle number review as a negative. This is in my emergency kit so I haven't had to use it, but it's there when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got these for Christmas presents for our 72 hour kits
customer_reviews.author: YJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Compass doesn’t work but I didn’t buy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Compass doesn’t work but I didn’t buy it for the compass. So far I tested it on sink water, defininatly does make a difference in taste.
customer_reviews.author: Cha Xiong

customer_reviews.title: The whistle didn't work that well and the compass barely ...
customer_reviews.text: The whistle didn't work that well and the compass barely moved no matter which way I faced. The straw worked but was slow but I kinda expected that
customer_reviews.author: Brody

customer_reviews.title: Give to a  boots on the ground combat soldier.
customer_reviews.text: As a soldier I have been to more countries than most Americans have been to states! This would’ve kept me from becoming sick! Not all countries have bottled water !!!
customer_reviews.author: Old sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Compass seems to hang a bit on the item I ...
customer_reviews.text: Compass seems to hang a bit on the item I tested, not as free and fast as my Silva, but close enough.
customer_reviews.author: Secret Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected..... very nice.
customer_reviews.text: This was described perfectly..... we got exactly what we thought we were getting. My husband is very pleased with your product. It's just as described...
customer_reviews.author: Tina Lazzara

customer_reviews.title: Get This
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely necessary for any hiking or camping application. Being able to drink from virtually any water source is a feat everyone should be able to perform. This product delivers that and more in a small package, with a very long life span.
customer_reviews.author: waterfire7

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for camping. It filters 396 gallons but for filtatration you get is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t think it works
customer_reviews.text: It does not change to taste or color of the water, so I don’t think it is truly filtering anything at all. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BarbaraS

customer_reviews.title: Water Rescue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as an emergency resource. Water is needed for survival. This is easy to store and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Better doorstops already exist.
customer_reviews.text: Utter garbage. Compass kinda works, straw does not. Whistle does work, but poorly. 0/10
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was everything I expected. I will be anxious ...
customer_reviews.text: It was everything I expected. I will be anxious to take it into the field. Priced right and delivered right away. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Craig A. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Everything seems to be very good. I bought this as a birthday gift for ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to be very good. I bought this as a birthday gift for my grand son he it really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: David Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Extreme hunter
customer_reviews.text: Havnt used it put it in my pack the compass is a joke it is cheap and useless hopfully filter does the job if needed
customer_reviews.author: Extreme Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Survival
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for use should have come with the filters, and not on my email the a few days later.
customer_reviews.author: Marion W., Jones

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: I got my package in 2 days I do not have amazon prime it came fast works in my back stream. It is cantamated with cow poop
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Product as expected. Packers broke it however.
customer_reviews.text: It's what I expected. And I like it. The compass part was damaged and unusable however. I do not attribute that to the maker. Probably the packers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: Used in Vietnam while traveling! A lifesaver! Easy to use... Shocked some locals! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: James Boutot

customer_reviews.title: not what i expected
customer_reviews.text: seemed kinda poorly made, was dirty somehow despite being in three bags. Also the compass seemed broken
customer_reviews.author: mono832

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I purchased a LifeStraw at the same time
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I purchased a LifeStraw at the same time. The straw made this way easier to use with my deep water bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Madeleine Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Haven't actually used the straw, but for the price, seems fair. The whistle works, I'm assuming the straw works... The compass, eh. You REALLY have to set it on a flat surface and tap it a few times. I was holding it in my hand and walking around, stopping periodically... And the needle faced everywhere but north! Lol. Flat surface, tap a few times, use common sense, and you'll find north.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Goullette

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs way up!
customer_reviews.text: Love it so much I even trained others to use it...
customer_reviews.author: ana rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: Survival filter that does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: Need something lightweight that could save your bacon in the wilds of the back country? Look no further. You have found it. This water filter takes up practically no room in your day pack. It comes with a basic compass, which will do the job if needed. Not as accurate as a GPS device, but for basic navigation, it will do the job. The filter itself cleans water of contaminants to give you the fresh water your body needs. It has a clip that will attach it to cords on your kayak or raft, or to your day pack or long distance backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bug out bag essential...
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a great price - necessity for any serious prepper...
customer_reviews.author: Marlo E. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: As described and very light. The package arrived 5 days early.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Abel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is what they say it is can't wait to use it in a couple of weeks
customer_reviews.author: Aaron R.

customer_reviews.title: these are everywhere so finding one in an extremis situation should be easy. The little touches like a compass
customer_reviews.text: The filter is everything I had hoped for. I was particularly intrigued by the fitting for a 2 liter bottle. Unfortunately, these are everywhere so finding one in an extremis situation should be easy. The little touches like a compass, whistle and a signal mirror are appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Buck S

customer_reviews.title: Water Filter Straw at it's best for camping with scouts and water is needed when ...
customer_reviews.text: Water Filter Straw at it's best for camping with scouts and water is needed when you are off the trail!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: so it's great when you run out of water and you have ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of this . I hunt wild boar in the jungle on the Pacific island where there's no shortage of water, but it's rarely clean because of erosion from the wild pigs . Sometimes you track them for hours without ever seeing any land features because you're under such thick canopy, so it's great when you run out of water and you have the filter AND a compass to get you figured out
customer_reviews.author: Monique Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Seems ok, not really sure about the quality though ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems ok, not really sure about the quality though, I know the compass doesn't work at all. Think they offered to swap them out but I didn't see it being worth the shipping, cheap parts are cheap parts
customer_reviews.author: Down with the Crown

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my survival-enthusiastic husband and he loves it. Here is why: - This filters down to one micron, which is better filtration than the Lifestraw and makes drinking water safer - It has multiple purposes with the whistle, compass, mirror, and the tourniquet - You can actually screw it onto a water bottle to drink. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Water Filter
customer_reviews.text: Works just as described. Shipping was very fast. Great addition to my big out bag
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Good filter for hiking/backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I tried three different brands of water bottles around the house before I got it to fit on one right. Squeezing the water thru the filter was a little hard at first but once the water started flowing it worked well. I back flushed it and let it dry out for a day before packing it in my bag for my upcoming trip to Big Bend. The extra compass, mirror and whistle are OK, but had no effect on my purchase decision. It is nice and light at 106 grams in the package (90 grams as pictured). I like that there are no extra parts or complicated procedures to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Used a friends worked great so I have one for backup and will never ...
customer_reviews.text: hopefully because I have it I won't need it but if my main water filter fails on a trip this little guy had my back! Used a friends worked great so I have one for backup and will never be without
customer_reviews.author: amanda arnold

customer_reviews.title: Great additions.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't opened my survival straw yet, but I look forward to being able to use it if the need arises. The extra capabilities that come with this straw such as the built in compass are a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Furba

customer_reviews.title: A valuable item for you and your family.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent water filter, great emergency water purification while camping, bush rafting and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Josefina Pinedo

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: My friend is a big camper and loves hiking. She loves this.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Water Filter Straw with .1 Micron Purifier for...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get a chance to use it, but like to keep it around just in case
customer_reviews.author: VLADIMIR B STRULEV

customer_reviews.title: Water everywhere...
customer_reviews.text: Nice multipurpose hiking device. Well made and functional. Light weight packs easy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mogridge

customer_reviews.title: It appears to be in great condition, was packed well and instructions were clear
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used it yet. I'm saving it for emergency use and am going to keep it in my "bug out" back pack. It appears to be in great condition, was packed well and instructions were clear. I fully expect it to work as advertised. I will probably try it out this summer on a hiking trip. I consider it a great essential addition to my bug out gear. And the compass and whistle will be handy also. The compass is working fine, pointing north as it should. I recommend this product for a lightweight emergency water purifier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Loveall

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my boss of all people and let me tell you this one missed quality control damn compass doesn’t work wissle cap is so flimsy you can blow on it and it falls off ....very disappointed my boss is now wondering if it’s even safe to use .....just wow
customer_reviews.author: Austin Mason

customer_reviews.title: Smart to have
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to open. Plan to put with our survival gear. I question the 5 year shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Green

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift for an Eagle Scout who loves ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for an Eagle Scout who loves camping and fishing. He was extremely excited by the idea of it. I will update when I get feedback from him after use.
customer_reviews.author: Sage Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it to add to my bug out bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it and hope I don't need to BUT I sure hope it works if I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Seems sturdy, clear I instructions
customer_reviews.text: Took a while til I opened the product package. Very interesting combination of pieces. Seems sturdy, clear I instructions. Haven't tried it yet, thank goodness I haven't had to use it. Especially happy to see that it's possible to filter water into a glass or bottle and not have to bend over sipping out of a puddle. Sent one to a friend, she liked it too. Fully recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gwen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband was so excited to add this to our camping/survival pack!
customer_reviews.author: Emily D.

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS!!! Great for the Fly fisherman who packs light!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Why wouldnt you carry such a small,lightweight multi use item with you that can fit in your pocket .This item has multiple uses that can get you through some possible life threatening situations.I do have a larger water purifier but for the size of this I couldn't pass it up. I do a lot of fly fishing so this will be a perfect fit for sliding into my smaller chest pack. All of the different components of this filter are VERY easy to use.You do not have to be going camping to use this item.Buy one for your vehicle for that extra piece of mind. This would also make a great gift for that person who has everything.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Useless!
customer_reviews.text: Compass doesn't work. Whistle doesn't work. Cheaply made. Doubt the filter works?
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to take with us on a 4 day 80+ mile canoe trip. Read all instructions and followed perfectly. Tried using with included straw and with water bottle as shown. Water did come out a little clearer, but tasted just like if you drank it out of the river. Was highly disappointing, and our other brand filter worked perfectly. This is NOT a good emergency filter.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lanter

customer_reviews.title: Great item for a bugout bag
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my brother for Christmas. Great item for a bugout bag! Small enough and light weight that it won't take up much space in bag.
customer_reviews.author: jody marie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband was very excited to get this for Christmas
customer_reviews.author: Beth Grieb

customer_reviews.title: Some confusion on benefits
customer_reviews.text: The product description says it filters 1500 liters. When the product arrives the packaging outlines it filters 1K liters. Also, because 1K liters is not too much, purchased a competitor product which filters 100K liters at the same price after purchasing this. Overall, wish I'd have researched a little more before purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ive

customer_reviews.title: It sucked
customer_reviews.text: didn't even work first use. Complete crap of a product and waste of money , compass didn't work etheir .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy. Made in china. Could be poisonous.
customer_reviews.text: Can't open and see what the filter is made of. Can't tell what is inside. Cat poop?
customer_reviews.author: Sam Hay

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than 3xpected
customer_reviews.text: A bit bigger than I expected. Thought it was a straw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Survival Hax Water Filter Straw with .1 Micron Purifier for Camping & Hiking (Green)
feature_bullets: FILTER STRAW - Removes dirt and contaminants from rivers, lakes, ponds, creeks, mud puddles, and third world tap water.
.1 MICRON PURIFIER - Eliminates 99.9999% of parasites and bacteria.
WORKS WITH BOTTLES - This filter can screw directly onto to any standard 28mm water bottle.
PORTABLE & LIGHT - Our personal purifier straw is 7.5 inches long and weighs less than ½ pound.
Bonus Survival Gear - Your straw comes with a carabiner, signalling mirror, tourniquet / extension tube, bear whistle, and compass.
